column4: Hello. Since a few days ago I have a problem with Flash. Whenever I start a Flash-movie in any browser the plugin either seems to crash after a few seconds or stalls the brwoser(s) for some seconds. It's impossible to watch any Flash movie anymore in Browsers because they all lag every few seconds, if they don't crash.
what browser, and what version of flash?
try installing flash manually
I'll try, though I think I already did that. Do you know if I have to restart the system or should Flash be detected automatically?
i would think automatically detected, i've never had a problem with it being auto detected
how did you try to install it manually?
I think I tried Synaptic, removing and reinstalling it. And then a Firefox-extension named "Flash Aid" that is supposed to install the correct version. Didn't help.
thats not really installing manually
So what exactly do you mean?
what version of ubuntu are you using again?
go to http://www.adobe.com  then click downloads then "get flash player"
once on that page,  where it says "Select version to Download"... choose ".tar.gz for linux"
if you do what i told you, this will resolve in about 10 seconds
Just download and extracted the archive.
right click the "libflashplayer.so" file   and click copy
then go to /home/username/.mozilla  (you might need to click "View/Show hidden files/directories" too see this directory)
Then into "plugins" I asssume?
affirmative
now, close any instance of a browser running
Nope, didn't help. Flash in FX still stalls the whole browser every few seconds.
dunno, when i had the problem you were having, thats what i done, and it works fine.. is it working in other browsers? (chrome for example?)
Nope, doesn't work in other browsers either. Thanks anyway.
